metadata.Title: CVE-2019-16718 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In radare2 before 3.9.0, a command injection vulnerability exists inbin_symbols() in libr/core/cbin.c. By using a crafted executable file, it'spossible to execute arbitrary shell commands with the permissions of thevictim. This vulnerability is due to an insufficient fix for CVE-2019-14745and improper handling of symbol names embedded in executables.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16718` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libradare2-4.2.1 - 4.2.1+dfsg-1
libradare2-common - 4.2.1+dfsg-1
radare2 - 4.2.1+dfsg-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: radare2 package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.1+dfsg-1').
